objdescid.compdate: c. 1789The date, based on stylistic considerations, is far from certain.

objinfo.leafsize: 34.1 x 43.8 cm.The fact that the head of the figure standing on the right in the drawing on the recto of this leaf is cut off suggests that the leaf was trimmed at the top after the drawing was executed.

provenance.name: Rosenbach Museum and Library
provenance.note: Early history unknown; William A. White by 1905; acquired by the dealer A. S. W. Rosenbach, probably c. 1927-29; bequeathed to the Rosenbach Museum and Library in 1952 and accessioned by the Museum in 1954.

objnote.p: A pencil drawing, A Old Man Seated Leaning on a Pile of Books; A Young Man Approaches, is on the recto of this drawing.

illustration.illusobjdesc: The single figure in this drawing sits in a twisted position with torso facing forward, legs extended left, arms extended right, and head facing right. He(?) may be nude. Both legs appear to be bent at the knee. His arms are raised horizontally, slightly bent, with right hand placed on top of the left. The figure leans slightly to the right.

component.illusobjdesc: The single figure in this drawing sits in a twisted position with torso facing forward, legs extended left, arms extended right, and head facing right. He(?) may be nude. Both legs appear to be bent at the knee. His arms are raised horizontally, slightly bent, with right hand placed on top of the left. The figure leans slightly to the right.
